text: it was easy to descend to the bottom of the well by employing the rope ladder which had not been used since the establishment of the lift .
and all arming themselves with hatchets , carbines , and revolvers , threw themselves into the lift and soon set foot on the shore .
arrived at the door , harding and pencroft made him take his place in the lift , while neb , herbert , and gideon spilett waited for them before granite house .
the lift was put in motion , and herbert was soon stretched on his bed in granite house .
of course the little stream which fed the reservoir of granite house and worked the lift , had been carefully preserved , and the water could not fail .
it was on the 17th of march that the lift acted for the first time , and gave universal satisfaction .

the ladders , which were formerly used for the ascent , were brought to the chimneys and buried deep in the sand , so that they might be available on the return of the colonists , for the machinery of the lift had been taken to pieces , and nothing of the apparatus remained .

to spring into the lift , hoist themselves up to the door of granite house , where top and jup had been shut up since the evening before , to rush into the large room , was the work of a minute only .
" yes ! blown up , just as if ayrton had set fire to the powder ! " returned pencroft , throwing himself into the lift together with neb and the lad .
" poor man ! " said herbert , who had rushed to the door , but returned , having seen ayrton slide down the rope on the lift and disappear in the darkness .
